semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Category I69 and Personal History of TIA/Cerebral Infarction
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 9. Diseases of the Circulatory System > d. Sequelae of Cerebrovascular Disease > 3) Codes from category I69 and Personal history of transient ischemic attack (TIA) and cerebral infarction (Z86.73)

content.full_text: Codes from category I69 should not be assigned if the patient does not have neurologic deficits. (Evidence: pg no: 54, L80-L83)
content.summary: Guidelines restricting use of I69 codes to patients with actual neurologic deficits (Evidence: pg no: 54, L80-L83)
key_concepts: I69 codes require neurologic deficits (Evidence: pg no: 54, L82-L83)
No I69 without deficits (Evidence: pg no: 54, L82-L83)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not assign I69 codes without neurologic deficits (Evidence: pg no: 54, L82-L83)
detailed_rules.explanation: Codes from category I69 should not be assigned if the patient does not have neurologic deficits (Evidence: pg no: 54, L82-L83)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify history of cerebrovascular disease
Step 2: Assess for current neurologic deficits
Step 3: If no deficits present, do not use I69 codes
Step 4: Consider personal history codes instead

code_ranges.description: Sequelae of cerebrovascular disease (Evidence: pg no: 54, L82)
code_ranges.requirement: Only use when neurologic deficits present
usage_rules: Do not assign without neurologic deficits (Evidence: pg no: 54, L82-L83)

specific_codes.description: Personal history of transient ischemic attack (TIA) and cerebral infarction (Evidence: pg no: 54, L80-L81)
specific_codes.context: Use when no current neurologic deficits

breakdown.Z86: Personal history of certain other diseases
breakdown..73: Personal history of TIA and cerebral infarction

references_to.title: History (of) for use of personal history codes
references_to.explanation: Referenced for proper use of personal history codes

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with history of stroke but no current neurologic deficits
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: History of cerebral infarction 3 years ago, no residual neurologic deficits
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify history of cerebral infarction
Step 2: Assess for current neurologic deficits
Step 4: Assign personal history code Z86.73

correct_coding.rationale: No neurologic deficits present, so I69 codes not appropriate (Evidence: pg no: 54, L82-L83)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Would be incorrect without neurologic deficits
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using I69 codes for history without current deficits

warnings: Never use I69 codes without neurologic deficits (Evidence: pg no: 54, L82-L83)
best_practices: Assess for current neurologic deficits before coding I69 (Evidence: pg no: 54, L82-L83)
Use personal history codes when no deficits present
common_mistakes: Using I69 codes for stroke history without deficits
tips: Document presence or absence of neurologic deficits clearly
